content: "The fifty-year embargo just hasn’t worked,” CBC Chairwoman Barbara Lee (D-Ca.) told reporters this evening at a Capitol press conference after returning from a congressional delegation visit to Cuba. “The bottom line is that we believe its time to open dialogue with Cuba." "http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0409/21008.html" It has failed and that is a very sad statement. It has failed only because we have compromised our position with free and unfair trade with China and any other commi nation. So whats the point of picking on little old Cuba? Not that I agree, but I also never agreed nor will ever agree to free and open markets with any country that is not an open nation that does not treat it's people the way our constitution is founded and based upon. Can't blame the CBC either, they do speak the truth although it is quite discusting for me to read. We have allowed many to sell out our standards for the all mighty dollar. This message has been edited. Last edited by: crackerjacks61, Tue 07 April 2009 05:30 PM

title: CBC members praise Castro

content: It's a tight squeeze for the one million Cuban/Americans living in Florida to open the flood gates or not. Our neighbor next door doesn't care for the restrictions place on communication, donations etc. Her gifts to relations are smuggled by tricks to get away from the 10% off the top to Castro Government. Of course that and tourist will improve their economy that seems to run against the grain of the other 50% and our government that wouldn't give Castro the time of day. One comment is that Fidel seeing his last days and his Brother is somewhat more flexible. Both stirs the inner fires for the lack of freedoms given to the population. After both are long gone the next government might pay more attention to the well being of average hombre. They need auto parts for all those 50' and 60' auto's, the junk dealers are looking for new customers. Won't this leave Hugo a might lonely? Have to admit there are many more rich millionaire Cubans now, than before Fidel. They just happen to reside in Florida and other US cities.

title: CBC members praise Castro

content: Castro, there's a man for the CBC to suck up to. "The Black Book of Communism estimates that 15,000-17,000 people were executed.[27] The author of the Historical Atlas, an online personal compilation of various sources, claims: The dividing line between those who have an axe to grind and those who don't falls in the 5,000-12,000 range.[23] The highest estimates are given by R.J. Rummel, Professor Emeritus of Political Science at the University of Hawaii. He claims the number of 73,000 as the mid-point estimate of victims of the alleged democide by the Castro administration. His low and high estimates are 35,000 and 141,000 respectively. One important reason his numbers are higher than those from other sources is because he counts the estimated deaths of refugees trying to flee and for example drowning as democide.[5 In any given year, there were about 20,000 dissents held and tortured under inhuman prison conditions.[28] From 1959 through 1993, some 1.2 million Cubans (about 10% of the current population) left the island for the United States[29], often by sea in small boats and fragile rafts." I guess there's something about mass murdering communist dictators they like. the above is from Wiki: ""http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_rights_in_Cuba
